intro: Hieracium isaricum, commonly known as the Isar hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous tiny florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and sometimes lobed. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium isaricum is often found in meadows, pastures, and disturbed soils, and it plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
